titles.title: Onii-chan no Koto Nanka Zenzen Suki ja Naindakara ne!!
I Don`t Like My Big Brother At All!
Oniichan no Koto Nanka Zenzen Suki Janain Dakara ne
腹黑妹妹控兄记
ochinko
お兄ちゃんのことなんかぜんぜん好きじゃないんだからねっ!!
Because I Don`t Like My Big Brother at All!

recommendations.recommendation: if after watching kissxsis or b gata u wanna check this out, DONT! cause of recommends and description you could assumed this is more visual and much perverted than other two, yet its opposite. more like talking the talk than walking the walk. for people who two previously mentioned series were too hardcore.

anime.description: * Based on http://anidb.net/cr23327 [Kusano Kouichi]`s online manga, serialised in the web comic magazine Web Comic High!. http://anidb.net/ch21802 [Takanashi Shuusuke] has a predilection for collecting pornographic books, DVDs and pictures. http://anidb.net/ch21803 [Nao] is Shuusuke`s younger sister. Rather than a cool older brother, she prefers the lewd older brother who desperately attempts to get a glimpse of her panties. One day, Shuusuke`s childhood friend http://anidb.net/ch21798 [Tsuchiura Iroha], whom he had not seen for 10 years, appears and immediately throws herself at Shuusuke. Thus, Shuusuke finds himself in a love triangle with Nao and Iroha. ~ translated and adapted from official site by Cranston

externalentity.identifier: お兄ちゃんのことなんかぜんぜん好きじゃないんだからねっ!!

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: dancing
tag.description: Dance is when people move their body to music. There are many kinds of dance, like ballet or waltz. Dancing can be done for fun but can be also an art.

tag.name: nopan
tag.description: The character foregoes underwear.

tag.name: tsukkomi
tag.description: A tsukkomi is a comedy duo stock character in a traditional Japanese slapstick stand-up comedy style known as manzai. Tsukkomi characters are the smart, reasonable, and down-to-earth half of the unit; their simple-minded counterparts are the http://anidb.net/t1399 [boke] characters. As a result of their boke counterparts` simple mistakes and gross exaggerations, tsukkomi berate and abuse them both verbally and physically; a very common example of tsukkomi physical abuse is a paper fan slap, which is generally accompanied by a sound effect. Their approximate equivalent in Western culture is the comedy role of straight man.

tag.name: seinen
tag.description: Seinen, literally "young man", is one of the main demographic classifications applied to manga, and, by extension, to anime, especially manga-based ones. As the name implies, seinen works are marketed primarily to an audience of young men; the age range commonly understood to be the target of such works goes roughly from 17 to somewhere in the 40s.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: fetishes
tag.description: Everything under fetishes (except for Bishounen and Juujin) is strictly only meant for hentai (18 Restricted) and ecchi anime. In case of ecchi, it must be the main element of the show and not when there`s only some of it, for example, there`s some ecchi in Shinseiki Evangelion, but the fact you get to see Asuka`s pantsu doesn`t warrant it the schoolgirl fetish category. So be careful to which ecchi show you add fetishes; it`s fairly straightforward with hentai, though. Overall, this category tree is to satisfy the needs of people with different fetishes, so they can search for what tingles their tangle; hence why this is restricted to hentai and full ecchi shows.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: present
tag.description: Somewhere between past and future.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: shoujo ai
tag.description: Shoujo Ai means girls love, and thus explores what happens when two girls (or women) fall in love. This is not to be mistaken for http://anidb.net/t2695 [Yuri] which is (or, at least, how this term is often used by the western audience) used in adult works. This is not; that means there is no graphic sex. The male version is http://anidb.net/t2783 [Shounen Ai]. http://anidb.net/t7146 [Cute girls doing cute things (CGDCT)] is often mistaken as low level Yuri or Shoujo Ai. If there is no Yuri or Shoujo Ai subtext, i.e. if there is no romantic subtext, only tag CGDCT. Please note: CGDCT and yuri/shoujo ai are not mutually exclusive; it is possible to have an anime tagged both.

tag.name: plot continuity
tag.description: Consistency of the characteristics of persons, plot, objects, places and events seen by the viewer. A single linear focused plot is highly continuous. A truly random plot is highly discontinuous.

tag.name: performance
tag.description: The song performance on stage or acting in a theatre is a central part of the character`s life in this anime type.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: sexual fantasies
tag.description: One or more characters in this anime let their imaginations run wild thinking about another character. Yes, they are thinking about sex, and in an ecchi anime these thoughts are often perverted, leading to a nosebleed. But it may also be romanticising simply being husband and wife, and everything that implies.

tag.name: pantsu
tag.description: "Panties" in Japanese. Upskirt views in various positions are typical, however all forms of partial or fully exposed panties are accepted. Exposure is usually accidental, but may also be deliberate. Pantsu views may be exclusive to the viewer without impacting any characters. Bikinis are not pantsu.

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: under one roof
tag.description: For some reason or another, the main protagonist (e.g. male in harem / female in reverse-harem) is living together with many other characters of the opposite-gender, all under the same roof (in the same dwelling unit).

tag.name: ecchi
tag.description: Fan service is found in many anime, in many forms. When the service has a distinctly sexual slant to it, and it appears to be a major focus of the show, then it`s safe to assume you`re watching ecchi. The word "ecchi" is used by English-speaking anime fans to refer to refer to soft-core pornographic or sexually suggestive anime and manga. This is a western invention; in Japanese, it is a catch-all term for all things anyhow sexual in nature, not being limited to porn, but also not really considered a "milder" term, as it may also refer to sexual intercourse itself. The term "ecchi" in Japanese comes from the pronunciation of the letter "H" in English, which is rendered into Japanese syllabary as エッチ, which in turn is transliterated in the English alphabet as "ecchi" or "etchi". It is not, as many believe, short for "hentai" -- that, too, seems to be a western invention. It is, however, nearly as misunderstood and misapplied a term as "hentai". The line between ecchi and hentai, from the western perspective over these terms, can be hard to draw at times; one good rule of thumb is: if it was aired on Japanese public TV at all, it probably wasn`t hentai. Ecchi usually features all the specifics to human anatomy that can only be found in anime, and generally avoids full nudity, instead abusing of panty shots. Hentai, on the other hand, will usually show full frontal nudity in some explicit form, including genitalia, and full, intimate sex scenes. At its mildest, ecchi is composed of double entendres, big misunderstandings, and sexual farce; at its most explicit, it is still in the realm of softcore pornography, with full breast shots, full back nudity and similar content, but no display of genitalia. Another good way to distinguish the two is looking for animated sex scenes; if one is found, you have generally left the genre entirely, though a few borderline exceptions apply here. For AniDB`s purposes, the distinction between explicit ecchi and actual hentai is simple: if it was sold with a 18+ restriction in its country of origin, it is hentai; if it was sold without it, it is ecchi. Source: TV Tropes

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: harem
tag.description: Harem is an entertainment-related trope which is characterized by three or more characters, normally female, who for some reason are in the presence and under the influence of one character, generally male, according to a few genre-defining guidelines; here it will be assumed, for simplicity of language, that the harem lead is a male character and the members are female characters. Though that is the rule, there are exceptions; a story in which there is one female character and several male characters is normally called a "http://anidb.net/t2792 [reverse harem]", or sometimes also "male harem". Aside from the swapping of the characters` genders, the trope`s details are mostly the same, with the majority of the changes relating to the differences in behavior between men and women of the characters` age range. It is also possible to create harems with homosexual relationships, again with very few changes to the main antics themselves. The harem may not have more than only one lead, as that would be a love polygon, or less than three members, as one would form a couple and two would make a love triangle. As a defining rule of harem, the interactions between the lead and each of the individual members are filled with romantically or sexually loaded content, either implicitly, through innuendo or subtext, or explicitly, through text or actions, and those actions are a key plot element. Generally, the female characters` looks and personalities will vary a lot among the ones present in one single series, but quite rarely will they actually differ from the common stock archetypes, which are known, well-defined, and easy to copy; for this reason, the genre as a whole is often considered repetitive. Usually, the characters involved directly in this trope are in the late teenager to young adult age range, but that is not mandatory. Sexually charged behavior on the lead`s part pretty much can`t be avoided, and it`s typical to see him stamped as a pervert by some or all of the members, regardless of whether he is one; the sexual tones also applies to the depiction of the harem members, often leading the genre to labeled sexist. The lead will often suffer very violent retribution for his behavior, which has attracted criticism of gratuitous violence as well. Most of the harem members will be romantically or sometimes sexually interested in the one male character, and in him alone; that, however, is not an absolute rule, and indeed sometimes none of the female characters are really interested at first, so the protagonist has to build relationships with them from scratch. That idea comes in large part from visual novels; it is quite common for visual novels to revolve around controlling the male lead and have him build relationships with either as many female characters as possible or with one of them, the latter being more common for visual novels with branched story paths; a large portion of those visual novels also feature erotic content, which may be hard to adapt to TV series. It may be also possible that the harem is only a support to the existing or predictable relationship between the lead and the most important member; additionally, the lead may end up in relationships with most or all of the harem members, with the agreement of all, in a setting normally called "harem ending".

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: the arts
tag.description: The arts represent an outlet of human expression, usually influenced by culture, and driven by human creative impulse. Major constituents of the arts include literature – including poetry, novels and short stories, and epics; performing arts – among them music, dance, and theatre; culinary arts such as baking, chocolatiering, and winemaking; media arts like photography and film, and visual arts – including drawing, painting, and sculpting. Some art forms combine a visual element with performance (e.g. film) and the written word (e.g. comics). From prehistoric cave paintings to modern day films, art serves as a vessel for storytelling and conveying mankind`s relationship with its environment. Source: Wiki

tag.name: coming of age
tag.description: In the strict sense the Coming of age describes a young person`s transition from adolescence to adulthood. In anime the term is used in a more general sense where the protagonists have to face a challenge, make an important decision in their life, take on responsibility, or learn a lesson, and by overcoming these obstacles they reach a higher level of maturity.

tag.name: foot fetish
tag.description: Anime contains scenes which revolve around foot-fetishism.

tag.name: female student
tag.description: Pretty much exclusive to hentai shows only unless an ecchi show has implied sex and/or a strong indicator of nudity. A character is considered a student if she goes to school, doesn`t matter if it`s high school, college or homeschooling, but she should be of appropriate age for a student; a housewife going to college should not get this category.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: belly dance
tag.description: Belly dance is any solo, improvised dance based on torso articulation originating from the Middle East. Belly dance takes many different forms depending on region, both in costume and dance style, and new styles have evolved in the West as its popularity has spread globally. In the Middle East, belly dance has two functions: as a social dance, it is performed by ordinary men and women of all ages at celebrations and social gatherings, although in more traditional societies such occasions are gender segregated, with separate parties for men and women; as an art, professionals perform it with an emphasis on stagecraft and special costumes designed to show off the movements to best effect, but they are not seen as respectable in the Middle East, with a strong social stigma attached to female dancers in particular, since the display of their bodies in public is considered sinful. (Source: Wikipedia)

tag.name: TV censoring
tag.description: The TV version is censored and later DVD/BD releases are uncensored, so the money-grubbing capitalists can make a couple more bucks at our expense.

tag.name: facial distortion
tag.description: The characters face are exaggerated into a misshape, deformed, and almost warped. Used as comedy element to express extreme mood swings. Differing from "http://anidb.net/t2652 [Super Deformed]", here only the face changes to an extreme degree, not the whole body of the protagonist.

tag.name: non-blood-related siblings -- DO NOT USE -- TO BE DELETED
tag.description: This tag is set to be deleted. Please add char-char relations of the "is family of" type with the http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Content:Characters#is_family_of [appropriate relation comment] to the relevant characters and remove the tag from the corresponding anime. Thank you.

tag.name: intact family
tag.description: The main character`s family is a so-called "nuclear family". Wherein both parents are alive and present in his or her life. This is actually relatively rare for anime, where "parental abandonment" is the norm.

tag.name: i got a crush on you
tag.description: It happens when a person develops an interest in someone that seems mysterious, smart, sexy, cute, fun, etc. Basically just someone you would like to spend more time with. Crushes are usually one sided and they happen more frequently among middle and high school students. A person with a crush usually has a hard time expressing or conveying his/her feelings to that other person. That other person is usually clueless of the situation. Sometimes that person knows about the crush, but feels annoyed or embarrassed by it for some reason. Having a crush on someone does not mean you are in love with that person, at least not yet. Depending on the situation crushes could develop differently (for better or worse): 1) Larger scale interactions (love). 2) Dating relationships. 3) Scary obsession or stalker type situations. 4) Disappear over time or distance.

tag.name: visible aura
tag.description: Characters are surrounded by a visible energy field usually representing inner strength, but not restricted to only that.

tag.name: otaku culture
tag.description: Otaku (おたく/オタク) is a Japanese term used to refer to people with obsessive interests, particularly anime, manga, and video games. A female otaku is occasionally referred to as a fujoshi. (Source: Wikipedia) Here certain aspects of this "fandom" are presented in more detail, e.g. the creation of doujinshi (self-published amateur manga).

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Suminoe Ako
character.description: Ako is the elder twin sister. She has a reliable, level-headed personality, but can be sullen and moody. She carries herself differently than her sister, is more skilled in cooking, and is strong with alcohol. She is a closet pervert and more often planning her seduction of Keita.

character.name: Suminoe Riko
character.description: Riko is the younger twin sister. She likes to do things at her own pace, and is more positive than Ako. She tends to be clumsy and is weak with alcohol. However, she is more proactive in tempting Keita to fall in love with her.

character.name: Kusakabe Yuuki
character.description: Yuuki is a mysterious girl that Takaaki meets in school at night, and for some reason she is not usually seen. She carries around a notebook called the "Trash Basket Notebook". In the anime, she is seen in a flashback as a young girl who is crying because she is moving away.

character.name: Charlotte Hazelrink
character.description: One of the four main heroines of the series. The princess of Hazelrink Principality, whom Teppei first meets and saves from a carriage incident involving thugs. She likes to tease Teppei and has a cheery nature.

character.name: Kokonoe Rin
character.description: Rin is a young girl in third grade who has an intense crush on her teacher Daisuke. She has a mischievous nature and has proclaimed herself to be Daisuke`s girlfriend; she will go to great lengths to make him fall in love with her. This has resulted in her crossing moral and legal boundaries many times, including blackmail and taking advantage of Daisuke`s inability to respond to her forcible advances by threatening to scream that he is trying to molest her, when in fact it is her that is making those advances. Despite Rin`s mischievous nature she has shown herself to care deeply for her friends and family, going to any length to defend them. Also much of her bad behavior is a result of trying to hide the traces of the vulnerable little girl she used to be as a result of a tragedy in her past.

character.name: Amahara Kiyono
character.description: A girl from a rich family who seems to be rather knowledgeable about the seedier side of underwear, and looks down upon Nayu for her naivety.

character.name: Katou Haruka
character.description: Nao`s friend and fellow classmate who is also known by her nickname `Haru-chan`. She is well known for her long black hair, and may be one of the few people with a little bit of common sense... but she`s also quite clumsy. She is very fashionable and has a fairly impressive bust size.

character.name: Tsuchiura Iroha
character.description: A transfer student that joined Nao`s class who is also Shuusuke`s childhood friend. Ten years ago she made a promise to Shuusuke but then had to transfer away due to her father`s work. Ever since then she has been waiting to reunite with Shuusuke so that she can get him to fulfill that promise. She has a very calculating and assertive personality, and that assertive personality comes out the most whenever she is with Shuusuke. She lives on the top floor in an apartment building, where she has set up a telescope so that she can spy on Shuusuke in his room.

character.name: Kusuhara Hirono
character.description: Nao`s friend and fellow classmate who is also known by her nickname `Hirorin`. She tends to view everything in the most melodramatic way possible, and has great fun watching the drama between Shuusuke, Nao and Iroha unfold. She is very fashionable and has a fairly impressive bust size.

character.name: Kondou Mayuka
character.description: Kondou Mayuka is Shuusuke`s classmate and class president, with a strong interest in Boy`s Love magazines. When one of her magazines is torn up by Shuusuke during a mix up with one of his, she makes him her `pet`, having him purchase more explicit BL magazines and review them for an unbiased opinion, though she interprets this as having a shared interest. Despite Shuusuke`s perverse belief that she may ask him to do something perverted at some point, she seems to be oblivious to this. Recently it is shown she has strong feelings for Shuusuke because of his apparent acceptance of her BL magazines.

character.name: Takanashi Shuuji
character.description: Shuuji is Shuusuke and Nao`s father. On the outside he looks like a reliable father, but he is actually quite tolerant of Shuusuke`s collections. His wife Nanaka often blames him for how Shuusuke has turned out.

character.name: Takanashi Shuusuke
character.description: Shuusuke is Nao`s big brother, and the eldest son of the Takanashi family. He is currently in his 2nd year of high school, and loves collecting as many naughty magazines, DVDs and pictures that he can get his hands on. He also has a healthy interest in school swimsuits, knee-socks and striped panties. When he gets a glance of Nao`s panties his mind gets filled with naughty thoughts... even though he knows it`s his little sister.

character.name: Takanashi Nao
character.description: Shuusuke`s younger sister. Everyone she knows thinks she just has a simple brother complex, but deep down inside she thinks it can go much further than that. Whenever she gets the chance she`ll secretly grab some of Shuusuke`s clothes so she gets her brother`s scent, she even keeps a "Big Brother Diary" and will take any opportunity she can to give him a glimpse of her panties. Although sometimes she also has to distance herself from her perverted brother, just so she can keep up the appearance that they really are just brother and sister.

character.name: Takanashi Nanaka
character.description: Nanaka is Shuuske and Nao`s mother. Nanaka completely spoils her daughter, and is always worried that Shuusuke is going to try something funny with Nao one day. She is very strict with Shuusuke, but in the end lets him get away with all sorts of things.

character.name: Shizuru
character.description: A fictional character from a little sister themed eroge Shuusuke owns who often shows up in his perverted dreams, usually those brought on by near death experiences.

character.name: Yatagai Ran
character.description: She is a cosplayer who goes under the alias `Princess Leila` and is very into her roleplay, suggesting she has a very loose grasp of reality. She seemingly makes a move on Shuusuke, dubbing him `her messiah`, and puts him through many strange trials, which are later revealed to train him to act out a warrior role in a cosplay event.

character.name: Yatagai Rin
character.description: Ran`s older twin sister. She is often annoyed by her sister, who often calls her `Clone`. Although she initially appears to help Nao stop Ran`s crazy plans, it is later revealed that she is a lesbian who has become interested in Nao`s lips as well as seems to have a harem of girls after her attention. In the end, she accidentally kisses Iroha and takes a liking to her instead.

episode.title: 兄と妹のヨコシマな日常
The Naughty Life of a Brother and Sister
Ani to Imouto no Yokoshima na Nichijou
episode.summary: Shuusuke Takanashi is a high school student that has started seeing his little sister Nao as a target for his fantasies. However, Nao doesn`t mind this at all... in fact, she loves seeing her brother`s nervous reactions whenever she encourages his perverted behavior by giving him a glimpse of her panties, or clinging to him all the time... all while pretending to just be a good little sister. One day Nao sneaks into Shuusuke`s room on the pretense of cleaning it up, but instead goes to take a look at all of his naughty magazines... but she also finds something she never expected to come across...

episode.title: ツインテール, 兄妹を襲撃
Twintailed Attack on the Brother and Sister
Twin Tail, Kyoudai o Shuugeki
episode.summary: It turns out that Nao and Shuusuke are not related by blood. While most people would be upset after finding out something like that, Nao took it in the most positive way possible - it meant that there was nothing to get in the way between her and Shuusuke. The next day, a new student named Iroha transfers into Nao`s class. At first Nao gets along with her really well, and they even end up having lunch together... but while they are eating Shuusuke comes to give Nao her keys which she left at home. Even though Iroha and Shuusuke should be meeting each other for the first time, Iroha seems strangely interested in him...

episode.title: 妹が水着に着替えたら
If Your Sister Puts a Swimsuit on...
Imouto ga Mizugi ni Kigaetara
episode.summary: The summer heat is unbearable, so Nao decides to ask Shuusuke to take her to the beach so they can cool off by the ocean. At first Shuusuke doesn`t seem too keen on the idea but after Nao hints that she knows about Shuusuke`s date with Iroha, Shuusuke quickly begs his mother for some money so that he can take Nao. But when they arrive they find out they`re not alone - Haruka and Hirono are also spending the day at the beach, and they have invited Iroha to join them as well. An unspoken battle between sister and childhood friend begins as the two girls fight over who should be with Shuusuke.

episode.title: ライバル出現! 兄妹大ピンチ!
A Rival Appears! Brother and Sister in Big Trouble!
Rival Shutsugen! Kyoudai Dai Pinch!
episode.summary: Although Shuusuke didn`t remember her at first, it turns out that Iroha is Shuusuke`s childhood friend - and she knows about all of his dirty secrets. Shuusuke is blackmailed into going on a date with Iroha, although he isn`t actually very keen on going. Nao realizes something fishy is going on, so she decides to follow him when he leaves the house and soon finds out that he is going on a date with Iroha. She decides to quietly stalk the two of them to see what happens between them. Iroha takes Shuusuke all over the place and keeps getting bolder and bolder as the date progresses - eventually she even asks Shuusuke to help her put a swimsuit on. However she isn`t going to let it end with just that - as their date comes to a close, she invites him to do even more naughty things with her... but how is Nao going to react to hearing that?

episode.title: ミスターX 兄襲!
Mister X Strikes Brother!
Mister X Kei Kasane!
episode.summary: Shuusuke sneaks out in the dead of night to pick up a naughty magazine, but on the way home he bumps into a mysterious person wearing a hood. Shuusuke apologizes to the person and quickly rushes home to enjoy his new treasure... but finds his new treasure has changed into a boy`s love magazine instead of the magazine he bought. He realizes he must have accidentally swapped packages when he bumped into the mysterious person, so he tears the magazine to pieces in protest. Meanwhile the mysterious hooded character is just as upset that the boy`s love magazine has been replaced by cute girls in naughty clothes... The next day, Shuusuke finds a blackmail message inside his shoe locker from someone named `Mister X`. It seems Mister X is the mysterious person he bumped into... and he wants to meet with him and exchange magazines. Shuusuke panics when he realizes that he already ripped up the boy`s love magazine, and in his panic he bumps into the student council president - Mayuka... which also lets him get a nice look at her black stockings and panties...

episode.title: 兄は黒パンストの夢を見る
My Brother has Dreams of Black Panty Stockings
Ani wa Kuro Pansuto no Yume o Miru
episode.summary: Shuusuke has discovered that Mister X is actually the student council president - Mayuka, and thanks to her Shuusuke has developed a brand new fetish - a fetish for black stockings... and he`ll even go so far as to become her pet and go out to buy Boy`s Love magazines for her, as long as he can get some glimpses of the panties beneath her stockings. Nao and Iroha start to feel threatened by the relationship between Shuusuke and Mayuka, so they make use of his new fetish to try and lure him back to them... they both sneak into his bed wearing black stockings while he is still sleeping... but what will happen when Mayuka finds out?

episode.title: 兄たちのAKIBA
My Brother and His Friends` Akiba
Ani-tachi no Akiba
episode.summary: In the early morning on a day off school, Shuusuke heads out and meets up with the AGE Explorers so they can all go on an expedition to Akihabara - the perfect place to pick up some of their favorite goods. Nao and Iroha are not sure what exactly Shuusuke is up to, so they decide to follow him and see where he goes. Nao is quick to notice that Shuusuke still hasn`t gotten over his black stocking fetish - he still seems to be looking out for anything with girls in stockings. But Shuusuke isn`t the only one looking for a specific fetish - all the members of the AGE Explorers each seem to have their own specific tastes, and it seems like each of them might have some trouble trying to get the others to agree which fetish is best...

episode.title: 兄のトップをねらえ!
Aim for Big Brother`s Top!
Ani no Top o Nerae!
episode.summary: Shuusuke continues to go out and buy magazines every night for Mayuka which causes him to fail all his subjects due to lack of studying. When Mayuka finds out about this, she organizes to visit him so she can help with his studies... but Iroha and Nao won`t just let her get away with more time alone with Shuusuke... so they decide to `help out` as well. While they are studying Iroha invites Shuusuke to a day at the pool, but Nao notices the tickets Iroha has will let both her and Mayuka go as well. All four head to the pool for a day of fun in the sun... swimsuits included!

episode.title: お兄ちゃんのことなんかぜんぜん好きじゃないんだからねっ!!
I Don`t Like My Big Brother at All!!
Onii-chan no Koto Nanka Zenzen Suki ja Naindakara ne!!
episode.summary: Shuusuke and Nao`s parents go out for the night, leaving the two siblings at home alone. Nao decides this is a once in a lifetime opportunity and starts to appeal to Shuusuke in every way she possibly can - including dressing up in a cute maid costume while Shuusuke is preparing dinner. But it doesn`t all turn out for the best - Shuusuke ends up knocking over a bowl of mayonnaise and the two end up a complete mess. They rush to the bathroom to get cleaned up, where Nao asks Shuusuke to undo the zip on the back of her maid outfit... but Shuusuke is simply too nervous to do it... Just how will the rest of the night unfold for the two of them...?

episode.title: 世界の中心で兄を叫ぶ
Calling Out to Brother from the Center of the World
Sekai no Chuushin de Ani o Sakebu
episode.summary: Shuusuke has been selected by Ran as the savior and is hard at work practicing to speak and act like a savior as he has been told he will be revealed as such in just two days time. On the other hand, Ran`s twin sister Rin has become strangely fond of Nao`s lips, and threatens to tell Shuusuke about Nao`s stalking if she doesn`t join her for lunch. Nao eventually asks Iroha for help getting away from Rin... but it might not work out just as planned...

episode.title: 兄は世界を救う
Brother Saves the World
Ani wa Sekai o Sukuu
episode.summary: On the way home from the convenience store late one night, Shuusuke meets a girl dressed in a rather risque outfit. The next day while he is reporting his find to the other AGE members, he finds out that the girl is actually a student at his school, and she leaves them a message telling them to meet her on the school`s rooftop once school is over. The girl he met is in fact Ran Yatagai, a famous cosplayer who goes by the name `Princess Leiya`. When Shuusuke and the others meet her after school, she tells them that they are candidates to become the savior of the world with her. The boys believes this might let them see Ran in some more erotic cosplay, so they play along with her. Nao, of course, has been quietly watching the whole thing unfold...

episode.title: 夏だ! 祭りだ! 兄妹のM:i:V
It`s Summer Time! It`s Festival Time! Brother and Sister`s M:i:V
Natsu Da! Matsuri Da! Kyoudai no M:i:V
episode.summary: Nao visits Shuusuke`s room wearing a yukata and asks if Shuusuke will take her to the Summer festival that is taking place that evening. At first Shuusuke seems hesitant as he doesn`t really have the money to go to a festival... but he simply can`t say no after Nao hints that she isn`t wearing anything underneath her yukata... so he once again begs his mother for a loan and accepts Nao`s request. As Shuusuke and Nao are leaving for the festival they bump into Iroha at the entrance to the house. She is also wearing a beautiful yukata and asks if she can accompany them to the festival, so the three of them head to the festival together. The other AGE members are also at the festival, but they seem to have another goal in mind for the evening...

episode.title: 妹より愛をこめて兄の『性態観察記』
Little Sister`s Diary of Brother`s Perverted Habits
Imouto Yori Ai o Komete Ani no "Sei Tai Kansatsuki"
